B2 [ U or S ] a feeling of liking for a person or place: She felt no affection for the child. He had a deep affection for his aunt. Synonyms
fondness
tenderness (GENTLE)
warmth (FEELING) affections [ plural ]
feelings of liking or love: The former president still holds a place in the nation's affections.
See more win someone's affections
to succeed in persuading someone to love you: Since his divorce, he has been suspicious of women who try to win his affections.
